articles.description: Trump’s tweet raising the prospect of nuclear war with North Korea isn’t in violation of Twitter’s guidelines, the company says, and will remain online. In the tweet, Trump boasted that his “Nuclear Button” is “much bigger” and “more powerful” than the one be…
articles.title: Why Twitter won’t remove Trump’s nuclear tweet
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.description: The proposed acquisition of global payment service MoneyGram by Alibaba’s Ant Financial is off after the U.S. government blocked the $1.2 billion deal. Ant Financial, the Alibaba affiliate which controls Alipay — China’s top mobile wallet — and other financia…
articles.title: The US government blocks MoneyGram’s $1.2B sale to Alibaba’s Ant Financial
articles.author: Jon Russell

articles.description: Excerpts from an insider account of Trump’s bumbling first year in office are making big news on Wednesday. Among the nuggets of new information, a source recounts the aftermath of the president-elect’s first sit-down with tech CEOs at Trump Tower. At the tim…
articles.title: Report: Silicon Valley Played Trump Like a Fiddle at Last Year's Tech Summit
articles.author: Rhett Jones

articles.description: The founders of Fusion GPS, the private intelligence firm that produced the so-called “Steele dossier,” took to The New York Times on Tuesday night and challenged congressional Republicans to release transcripts of their interviews before the House Intelligen…
articles.title: Fusion GPS Founders Urge Congress to Publish Russia Probe Testimony
articles.author: Dell Cameron

articles.description: Former Milwaukee County Sheriff David Clarke, the Donald Trump supporter best known for suspicious deaths in a jail he oversaw, blowing a potential job at the Department of Homeland Security amid a plagiarism scandal, and decorating his uniform with nearly as…
articles.title: Idiot Former Sheriff Sent to Internet Jail
articles.author: Tom McKay

articles.description: On New Year’s Eve, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un warned his enemies “that the whole territory of the U.S. is within the range of our nuclear strike and a nuclear button is always on the desk of my office, and this is just a reality, not a threat.” Read more…
articles.title: Donald Trump Retaliates Against Kim Jong Un's 'Nuclear Button' by Deploying Weapons of Self Humiliation
articles.author: Tom McKay

articles.description: North Korea conducted a missile test on April 28, 2017 that didn’t go quite as planned. In fact, we’re now learning that the Hwasong-12 missile that the country launched actually went astray and may have hit the North Korean city of Tokchon. Read more...
articles.title: North Korea Accidentally Hit Its Own City During Missile Test According to New Report
articles.author: Matt Novak

articles.description: With less than a week before this year’s Consumer Electronics Show, Chairman of the Federal Communications Comission Ajit Pai has decided to bail on a scheduled appearance. Read more...
articles.title: Loathsome Shill Ajit Pai Drops Out of Planned CES Appearance
articles.author: Bryan Menegus

articles.description: Just in case you had trouble sleeping after Kim Jong Un and Donald Trump traded threats about each ruler’s “nuclear button,” the North Korean supreme leader also said something uncharacteristically optimistic in his New Year’s Day speech. Kim expressed hope f…
articles.title: North Korea Reopens Phone Line With South Korea, and the Phones Sure Are Weird
articles.author: Adam Clark Estes

articles.description: Bitcoin’s “ genesis block ”—the digital token’s very first set of transactions—was mined nine years ago today. The reward for the block computation is listed at 50 BTC, which at today’s price is worth roughly $670,000. Read more...
articles.title: A Not-So-Happy Birthday to Bitcoin
articles.author: Bryan Menegus

articles.description: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and President Trump at the White House in March.
articles.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Is the Trans-Atlantic Relationship Dead?

articles.description: President Trump during a Cabinet meeting last month. On Tuesday he tweeted that he commands a “much bigger” nuclear arsenal than North Korea does.
articles.title: Trump Again Taunts North Korea With Threat of Nuclear War

articles.title: Talk: Masha Gessen Is Worried About Outrage Fatigue

articles.description: The highly unusual lawsuit says the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, was given an overly broad mandate and needs to be reined in.

articles.description: A portion of a new rail tunnel that will cross the Hudson River between New Jersey and Manhattan. The tunnel is considered one of the country’s most important infrastructure projects.
articles.title: Did Trump Kill the Plan for a Hudson Rail Tunnel? Its Backers Hope Not
articles.author: PATRICK McGEEHAN

articles.description: Senator Mitch McConnell has promised a vote on immigration legislation if a bipartisan group of senators can reach agreement on a measure that would extend protection from deportation while also beefing up border security.
articles.title: Democrats Outline Demands as Threat of Shutdown Looms
articles.author: SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and THOMAS KAPLAN

articles.description: The window for legislative action to protect undocumented immigrants brought to the country as children will close by the middle of January, three former officials said in a letter.

articles.description: Ice floating along the banks of the Hudson River near the George Washington Bridge in Fort Lee, N.J., on Tuesday. The cold weather in North America, which has been blamed for a handful of deaths, is expected to continue at least into the weekend.
